   20: 
   21: -module(bif_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   24: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   25: 
   26: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   27: 
   28: -export([display/1, display_huge/0, display_string/1,
   29: 	 erl_bif_types/1,guard_bifs_in_erl_bif_types/1,
   30: 	 shadow_comments/1,list_to_utf8_atom/1,
   31: 	 specs/1,improper_bif_stubs/1,
   32: 	 t_list_to_existing_atom/1,os_env/1,otp_7526/1,
   33: 	 t_binary_to_atom/1,t_binary_to_existing_atom/1,
   34: 	 t_atom_to_binary/1,min_max/1, erlang_halt/1,
   35:          halt_flush_timeout/1, erl_crash_dump_bytes/1,
   36: 	 is_builtin/1, error_stacktrace/1,
   37: 	 error_stacktrace_during_call_trace/1,
   38:          group_leader_prio/1, group_leader_prio_dirty/1,
   39:          is_process_alive/1,
   40:          is_process_alive_signal_from/1,
   41:          process_info_blast/1,
   42:          os_env_case_sensitivity/1,
   43:          verify_middle_queue_save/1,
   44:          test_length/1,
   45:          fixed_apply_badarg/1,
   46:          external_fun_apply3/1,
   47:          node_1/1]).
   48: 
   49: suite() ->
   50:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   51:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
   52: 
   53: all() -> 
   54:     [erl_bif_types, guard_bifs_in_erl_bif_types, shadow_comments,
   55:      specs, improper_bif_stubs,
   56:      t_list_to_existing_atom, os_env, otp_7526,
   57:      display, display_string, list_to_utf8_atom,
   58:      t_atom_to_binary, t_binary_to_atom, t_binary_to_existing_atom,
   59:      erl_crash_dump_bytes, min_max, erlang_halt, halt_flush_timeout,
   60:      is_builtin, error_stacktrace, error_stacktrace_during_call_trace,
   61:      group_leader_prio, group_leader_prio_dirty,
   62:      is_process_alive, is_process_alive_signal_from,
   63:      process_info_blast, os_env_case_sensitivity,
   64:      verify_middle_queue_save, test_length,fixed_apply_badarg,
   65:      external_fun_apply3, node_1].
   66: 
   67: init_per_testcase(guard_bifs_in_erl_bif_types, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   68:     skip_missing_erl_bif_types(Config);
   69: init_per_testcase(erl_bif_types, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   70:     skip_missing_erl_bif_types(Config);
   71: init_per_testcase(shadow_comments, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   72:     skip_missing_erl_bif_types(Config);
   73: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
   74:     Config.
   75: 
   76: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   77:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   78: 
   79: %% erl_bif_types comes from dialyzer which some test runs skip building, so
   80: %% we'll skip the tests that use it as the result shouldn't vary based on
   81: %% platform. The majority build it so we'll have plenty coverage either way.
   82: skip_missing_erl_bif_types(Config) ->
   83:     c:l(erl_bif_types),
   84:     case erlang:function_exported(erl_bif_types, module_info, 0) of
   85:         false -> {skip, "erl_bif_types not compiled"};
   86:         true -> Config
   87:     end.
   88: 
   89: %% Uses erlang:display to test that erts_printf does not do deep recursion
   90: display(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   91:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
   92:     true = rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,display_huge,[]),
   93:     peer:stop(Peer),
   94:     ok.
   95: 
   96: display_huge() ->
   97:     erlang:display(deeep(100000)).
   98: 
   99: deeep(0,Acc) ->
  100:     Acc;
  101: deeep(N,Acc) ->
  102:     deeep(N-1,[Acc|[]]).
  103: 
  104: deeep(N) ->
  105:     deeep(N,[hello]).
  106: 
  107: display_string(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  108:     true = erlang:display_string("hej"),
  109:     true = erlang:display_string(""),
  110:     true = erlang:display_string("hopp"),
  111:     true = erlang:display_string("\n"),
  112:     true = erlang:display_string(lists:seq(1100,1200)),
  113:     {error,badarg} = try
  114:                          erlang:display_string(atom),
  115:                          ok
  116:                      catch
  117:                          T0:E0 ->
  118:                              {T0, E0}
  119:                      end,
  120:     {error,badarg} = try
  121:                          erlang:display_string(make_ref()),
  122:                          ok
  123:                      catch
  124:                          T1:E1 ->
  125:                              {T1, E1}
  126:                      end,
  127:     ok.
  128: 
  129: erl_bif_types(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  130:     List = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  131: 
  132:     KnownTypes = [MFA || MFA <- List, known_types(MFA)],
  133:     io:format("There are ~p BIFs with type information in erl_bif_types.",
  134: 	      [length(KnownTypes)]),
  135:     erl_bif_types_2(KnownTypes).
  136: 
  137: erl_bif_types_2(List) ->
  138:     BadArity = [MFA || {M,F,A}=MFA <- List,
  139: 		       begin
  140: 			   Types = erl_bif_types:arg_types(M, F, A),
  141: 			   length(Types) =/= A
  142: 		       end],
  143:     case BadArity of
  144: 	[] ->
  145: 	    erl_bif_types_3(List);
  146: 	[_|_] ->
  147: 	    io:put_chars("Bifs with bad arity\n"),
  148: 	    io:format("~p\n", [BadArity]),
  149: 	    ct:fail({length(BadArity),bad_arity})
  150:     end.
  151: 
  152: erl_bif_types_3(List) ->
  153:     BadSmokeTest = [MFA || {M,F,A}=MFA <- List,
  154: 			   begin
  155: 			       try erl_bif_types:type(M, F, A) of
  156: 				   Type ->
  157: 				       %% Test that type is returned.
  158: 				       not erl_types:is_erl_type(Type)
  159: 			       catch
  160: 				   Class:Error ->
  161: 				       io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n",
  162: 						 [MFA,Class,Error]),
  163: 				       true
  164: 			       end
  165: 			   end],
  166:     case BadSmokeTest of
  167: 	[] ->
  168: 	    ok;
  169: 	[_|_] ->
  170: 	    io:put_chars("Bifs with failing calls to erlang_bif_types:type/3 "
  171: 			 "(or with bogus return values):\n"),
  172: 	    io:format("~p\n", [BadSmokeTest]),
  173: 	    ct:fail({length(BadSmokeTest),bad_smoke_test})
  174:     end.
  175: 
  176: guard_bifs_in_erl_bif_types(_Config) ->
  177:     List0 = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  178:     List = [{F,A} || {erlang,F,A} <- List0,
  179: 		     erl_internal:guard_bif(F, A)],
  180:     Not = [FA || {F,A}=FA <- List,
  181: 		 not erl_bif_types:is_known(erlang, F, A)],
  182:     case Not of
  183: 	[] ->
  184: 	    ok;
  185: 	[_|_] ->
  186: 	    io:put_chars(
  187: 	      ["Dialyzer requires that all guard BIFs "
  188: 	       "have type information in erl_bif_types.\n\n"
  189: 	       "The following guard BIFs have no type information "
  190: 	       "in erl_bif_types:\n\n",
  191: 	       [io_lib:format("  ~p/~p\n", [F,A]) || {F,A} <- Not]]),
  192: 	    ct:fail(erl_bif_types)
  193:     end.
  194: 
  195: shadow_comments(_Config) ->
  196:     ErlangList = [{erlang,F,A} || {F,A} <- erlang:module_info(exports),
  197: 				  not is_operator(F,A)],
  198:     List0 = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  199:     List1 = [MFA || {M,_,_}=MFA <- List0, M =/= erlang],
  200:     List = List1 ++ ErlangList,
  201:     HasTypes = [MFA || {M,F,A}=MFA <- List,
  202: 		       erl_bif_types:is_known(M, F, A)],
  203:     Path = get_code_path(),
  204:     BifRel = sofs:relation(HasTypes, [{m,f,a}]),
  205:     BifModules = sofs:to_external(sofs:projection(1, BifRel)),
  206:     AbstrByModule = [extract_abstract(Mod, Path) || Mod <- BifModules],
  207:     Specs0 = [extract_specs(Mod, Abstr) ||
  208: 		 {Mod,Abstr} <- AbstrByModule],
  209:     Specs = lists:append(Specs0),
  210:     SpecFuns0 = [F || {F,_} <- Specs],
  211:     SpecFuns = sofs:relation(SpecFuns0, [{m,f,a}]),
  212:     HasTypesAndSpecs = sofs:intersection(BifRel, SpecFuns),
  213:     Commented0 = lists:append([extract_comments(Mod, Path) ||
  214: 				  Mod <- BifModules]),
  215:     Commented = sofs:relation(Commented0, [{m,f,a}]),
  216:     {NoComments0,_,NoBifSpecs0} =
  217: 	sofs:symmetric_partition(HasTypesAndSpecs, Commented),
  218:     NoComments = sofs:to_external(NoComments0),
  219:     NoBifSpecs = sofs:to_external(NoBifSpecs0),
  220: 
  221:     case NoComments of
  222: 	[] ->
  223: 	    ok;
  224: 	[_|_] ->
  225: 	    io:put_chars(
  226: 	      ["If a BIF stub has both a spec and has type information in "
  227: 	       "erl_bif_types, there *must*\n"
  228: 	       "be a comment in the source file to make that immediately "
  229: 	       "obvious.\n\nThe following comments are missing:\n\n",
  230: 	       [io_lib:format("%% Shadowed by erl_bif_types: ~p:~p/~p\n",
  231: 			      [M,F,A]) || {M,F,A} <- NoComments]]),
  232: 	    ct:fail(bif_stub)
  233:     end,
  234: 
  235:     case NoBifSpecs of
  236: 	[] ->
  237: 	    ok;
  238: 	[_|_] ->
  239: 	    io:put_chars(
  240: 	      ["The following functions have \"shadowed\" comments "
  241: 	       "claiming that there is type information in erl_bif_types,\n"
  242: 	       "but actually there is no such type information.\n\n"
  243: 	       "Therefore, the following comments should be removed:\n\n",
  244: 	       [io_lib:format("%% Shadowed by erl_bif_types: ~p:~p/~p\n",
  245: 			      [M,F,A]) || {M,F,A} <- NoBifSpecs]]),
  246: 	    ct:fail(erl_bif_types)
  247:     end.
  248: 
  249: extract_comments(Mod, Path) ->
  250:     Beam = which(Mod, Path),
  251:     SrcDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(filename:dirname(Beam)), "src"),
  252:     Src = filename:join(SrcDir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl"),
  253:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(Src),
  254:     Lines0 = binary:split(Bin, <<"\n">>, [global]),
  255:     Lines1 = [T || <<"%% Shadowed by erl_bif_types: ",T/binary>> <- Lines0],
  256:     {ok,ReMFA} = re:compile("([^:]*):([^/]*)/(\\d*)"),
  257:     Lines = [L || L <- Lines1, re:run(L, ReMFA, [{capture,[]}]) =:= match],
  258:     [begin
  259: 	 {match,[M,F,A]} = re:run(L, ReMFA, [{capture,all_but_first,list}]),
  260: 	 {list_to_atom(M),list_to_atom(F),list_to_integer(A)}
  261:      end || L <- Lines].
  262: 
  263: known_types({M,F,A}) ->
  264:     erl_bif_types:is_known(M, F, A).
  265: 
  266: specs(_) ->
  267:     List0 = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  268: 
  269:     %% Ignore all operators.
  270:     List = [MFA || MFA <- List0, not is_operator(MFA)],
  271: 
  272:     %% Extract specs from the abstract code for all BIFs.
  273:     Path = get_code_path(),
  274:     BifRel = sofs:relation(List, [{m,f,a}]),
  275:     BifModules = sofs:to_external(sofs:projection(1, BifRel)),
  276:     AbstrByModule = [extract_abstract(Mod, Path) || Mod <- BifModules],
  277:     Specs0 = [extract_specs(Mod, Abstr) ||
  278: 		 {Mod,Abstr} <- AbstrByModule],
  279:     Specs = lists:append(Specs0),
  280:     BifSet = sofs:set(List, [function]),
  281:     SpecRel0 = sofs:relation(Specs, [{function,spec}]),
  282:     SpecRel = sofs:restriction(SpecRel0, BifSet),
  283: 
  284:     %% Find BIFs without specs.
  285:     NoSpecs0 = sofs:difference(BifSet, sofs:domain(SpecRel)),
  286:     NoSpecs = sofs:to_external(NoSpecs0),
  287:     case NoSpecs of
  288: 	[] ->
  289: 	    ok;
  290: 	[_|_] ->
  291: 	    io:put_chars("The following BIFs don't have specs:\n"),
  292: 	    [print_mfa(MFA) || MFA <- NoSpecs],
  293: 	    ct:fail(no_spec)
  294:     end.
  295: 
  296: is_operator({erlang,F,A}) ->
  297:     is_operator(F,A);
  298: is_operator(_) -> false.
  299: 
  300: is_operator(F,A) ->
  301:     erl_internal:arith_op(F, A) orelse
  302: 	erl_internal:bool_op(F, A) orelse
  303: 	erl_internal:comp_op(F, A) orelse
  304: 	erl_internal:list_op(F, A) orelse
  305: 	erl_internal:send_op(F, A).
  306:     
  307: extract_specs(M, Abstr) ->
  308:     [{make_mfa(M, Name),Spec} || {attribute,_,spec,{Name,Spec}} <- Abstr].
  309: 
  310: make_mfa(M, {F,A}) -> {M,F,A};
  311: make_mfa(M, {M,_,_}=MFA) -> MFA.
  312: 
  313: improper_bif_stubs(_) ->
  314:     Bifs = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  315:     Path = get_code_path(),
  316:     BifRel = sofs:relation(Bifs, [{m,f,a}]),
  317:     BifModules = sofs:to_external(sofs:projection(1, BifRel)),
  318:     AbstrByModule = [extract_abstract(Mod, Path) || Mod <- BifModules],
  319:     Funcs0 = [extract_functions(Mod, Abstr) ||
  320: 		 {Mod,Abstr} <- AbstrByModule],
  321:     Funcs = lists:append(Funcs0),
  322:     BifSet = sofs:set(Bifs, [function]),
  323:     FuncRel0 = sofs:relation(Funcs, [{function,code}]),
  324:     FuncRel = sofs:restriction(FuncRel0, BifSet),
  325:     [check_stub(MFA, Body) || {MFA,Body} <- sofs:to_external(FuncRel)],
  326:     ok.
  327: 
  328: extract_functions(M, Abstr) ->
  329:     [{{M,F,A},Body} || {function,_,F,A,Body} <- Abstr].
  330: 
  331: check_stub({_,F,2}, _B) when F =:= min; F =:= max ->
  332:     %% In Erlang/OTP 26, min/2 and max/2 are guard BIFs. For backward
  333:     %% compatibility with code compiled with an earlier version, the
  334:     %% Erlang implementation of them is kept.
  335:     ok;
  336: check_stub({_,F,A}, B) ->
  337:     try
  338: 	[{clause,_,Args,[],Body}] = B,
  339: 	A = length(Args),
  340: 	[{call,_,{remote,_,{atom,_,erlang},{atom,_,nif_error}},[_]}] = Body
  341:     catch
  342: 	_:_ ->
  343: 	    io:put_chars("Invalid body for the following BIF stub:\n"),
  344: 	    Func = {function,0,F,A,B},
  345: 	    io:put_chars(erl_pp:function(Func)),
  346: 	    io:nl(),
  347: 	    io:put_chars("The body should be: erlang:nif_error(undef)"),
  348: 	    ct:fail(invalid_body)
  349:     end.
  350: 
  351: list_to_utf8_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  352:     'hello' = atom_roundtrip("hello"),
  353:     'こんにちは' = atom_roundtrip("こんにちは"),
  354: 
  355:     %% Test all edge cases.
  356:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#80]),
  357:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#7F]),
  358:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#FF]),
  359:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#100]),
  360:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#7FF]),
  361:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#800]),
  362:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#D7FF]),
  363:     atom_badarg([16#D800]),
  364:     atom_badarg([16#DFFF]),
  365:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#E000]),
  366:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#FFFF]),
  367:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#1000]),
  368:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#10FFFF]),
  369:     atom_badarg([16#110000]),
  370: 
  371:     atom_badarg([-1]),
  372:     [atom_badarg([(-1 bsl N) + $A]) || N <- lists:seq(8,16)],
  373:     ok.
  374: 
  375: atom_roundtrip(String) ->
  376:     Atom = list_to_atom(String),
  377:     Atom = list_to_existing_atom(String),
  378:     String = atom_to_list(Atom),
  379:     Atom.
  380: 
  381: atom_badarg(String) ->
  382:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch list_to_atom(String)),
  383:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch list_to_existing_atom(String)),
  384:     ok.
  385: 
  386: t_list_to_existing_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  387:     all = list_to_existing_atom("all"),
  388:     ?MODULE = list_to_existing_atom(?MODULE_STRING),
  389:     UnlikelyStr = "dsfj923874390867er869fds9864y97jhg3973qerueoru",
  390:     try
  391: 	list_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyStr),
  392: 	ct:fail(atom_exists)
  393:     catch
  394: 	error:badarg -> ok
  395:     end,
  396: 
  397:     %% The compiler has become smarter! We need the call to id/1 in
  398:     %% the next line.
  399:     UnlikelyAtom = list_to_atom(id(UnlikelyStr)),
  400:     UnlikelyAtom = list_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyStr),
  401:     ok.
  402: 
  403: os_env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  404:     EnvVar1 = "MjhgvFDrresdCghN mnjkUYg vfrD",
  405:     false = os:getenv(EnvVar1),
  406:     true = os:putenv(EnvVar1, "mors"),
  407:     "mors" = os:getenv(EnvVar1),
  408:     true = os:putenv(EnvVar1, ""),
  409:     case os:getenv(EnvVar1) of
  410: 	      "" -> ok;
  411: 	      false -> ok;
  412: 	      BadVal -> ct:fail(BadVal)
  413: 	  end,
  414:     true = os:putenv(EnvVar1, "mors"),
  415:     true = os:unsetenv(EnvVar1),
  416:     false = os:getenv(EnvVar1),
  417:     true = os:unsetenv(EnvVar1), % unset unset variable
  418:     %% os:putenv, os:getenv and os:unsetenv currently use a temp
  419:     %% buffer of size 1024 for storing key+value
  420:     os_env_long(1010, 1030, "hej hopp").
  421:     
  422: os_env_long(Min, Max, _Value) when Min > Max ->
  423:     ok;
  424: os_env_long(Min, Max, Value) ->
  425:     EnvVar = lists:duplicate(Min, $X),
  426:     true = os:putenv(EnvVar, Value),
  427:     Value = os:getenv(EnvVar),
  428:     true = os:unsetenv(EnvVar),
  429:     os_env_long(Min+1, Max, Value).
  430: 
  431: os_env_case_sensitivity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  432:     %% The keys in os:getenv/putenv must be case-insensitive on Windows, and
  433:     %% case-sensitive elsewhere.
  434:     true = os:putenv("os_env_gurka", "gaffel"),
  435:     Expected = case os:type() of
  436:                    {win32, _} -> "gaffel";
  437:                    _ -> false
  438:                end,
  439:     Expected = os:getenv("OS_ENV_GURKA"),
  440:     ok.
  441: 
  442: %% Test that string:to_integer does not Halloc in wrong order.
  443: otp_7526(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  444:     ok = test_7526(256).
  445: 
  446: iterate_7526(0, Acc) -> Acc;
  447: iterate_7526(N, Acc) ->
  448:     iterate_7526(N - 1,
  449: 		 [case string:to_integer("9223372036854775808,\n") of
  450: 		      {Int, _Foo} -> Int
  451: 		  end | Acc]).
  452: 
  453: do_test_7526(N,M) ->
  454:     {Self, Ref} = {self(), make_ref()},
  455:     T = erlang:make_tuple(M,0),
  456:     spawn_opt(fun()->
  457:                       L = iterate_7526(N, []),
  458:                       BadList = [X || X <- L, X =/= 9223372036854775808],
  459:                       BadLen = length(BadList),
  460:                       M = length(tuple_to_list(T)),
  461:                       %%io:format("~b bad conversions: ~p~n", [BadLen, BadList]),
  462:                       Self ! {done, Ref, BadLen}
  463:               end,
  464:               [link,{fullsweep_after,0}]),
  465:     receive {done, Ref, Len} -> Len end.
  466: 
  467: 
  468: test_7526(0) ->
  469:     ok;
  470: test_7526(N) ->
  471:     case do_test_7526(1000,N) of
  472: 	0 -> test_7526(N-1);
  473: 	Other ->
  474: 	    {error,N,Other}
  475:     end.
  476: 
  477: -define(BADARG(E), {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch E)).
  478: -define(SYS_LIMIT(E), {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch E)).
  479: 
  480: t_binary_to_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  481:     HalfLong = lists:seq(0, 127),
  482:     HalfLongAtom = list_to_atom(HalfLong),
  483:     HalfLongBin = list_to_binary(HalfLong),
  484:     Long = lists:seq(0, 254),
  485:     LongAtom = list_to_atom(Long),
  486:     LongBin = list_to_binary(Long),
  487:     UnicodeLongAtom = list_to_atom([$é || _ <- lists:seq(0, 254)]),
  488:     UnicodeLongBin = << <<"é"/utf8>> || _ <- lists:seq(0, 254)>>,
  489: 
  490:     %% latin1
  491:     '' = test_binary_to_atom(<<>>, latin1),
  492:     '\377' = test_binary_to_atom(<<255>>, latin1),
  493:     HalfLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(HalfLongBin, latin1),
  494:     LongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(LongBin, latin1),
  495: 
  496:     %% utf8
  497:     '' = test_binary_to_atom(<<>>, utf8),
  498:     HalfLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(HalfLongBin, utf8),
  499:     HalfLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(HalfLongBin, unicode),
  500:     UnicodeLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(UnicodeLongBin, utf8),
  501:     UnicodeLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(UnicodeLongBin, unicode),
  502:     [] = [C || C <- lists:seq(128, 255),
  503: 		     begin
  504: 			 list_to_atom([C]) =/=
  505: 			     test_binary_to_atom(<<C/utf8>>, utf8)
  506: 		     end],
  507: 
  508:     ExoticBin = <<"こんにちは"/utf8>>,
  509:     ExoticAtom = test_binary_to_atom(ExoticBin, utf8),
  510:     ExoticBin = atom_to_binary(ExoticAtom, utf8),
  511:     ExoticBin = atom_to_binary(ExoticAtom),
  512: 
  513:     %% badarg failures.
  514:     fail_binary_to_atom(atom),
  515:     fail_binary_to_atom(42),
  516:     fail_binary_to_atom({a,b,c}),
  517:     fail_binary_to_atom([1,2,3]),
  518:     fail_binary_to_atom([]),
  519:     fail_binary_to_atom(42.0),
  520:     fail_binary_to_atom(self()),
  521:     fail_binary_to_atom(make_ref()),
  522:     fail_binary_to_atom(<<0:7>>),
  523:     fail_binary_to_atom(<<42:13>>),
  524:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<>>), blurf)),
  525:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<>>), [])),
  526: 
  527:     %% Bad UTF8 sequences.
  528:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<255>>), utf8)),
  529:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<255>>))),
  530:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<255,0>>), utf8)),
  531:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<16#C0,16#80>>), utf8)), %Overlong 0.
  532:     <<B:1/binary, _/binary>> = id(<<194, 163>>), %Truncated character ERL-474
  533:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(B, utf8)),
  534: 
  535:     %% system_limit failures.
  536:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(id(<<0:512/unit:8,255>>), utf8)),
  537:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(id(<<0:512/unit:8,255>>))),
  538:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(id(<<0:512/unit:8,255,0>>), utf8)),
  539:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:256/unit:8>>, latin1)),
  540:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:257/unit:8>>, latin1)),
  541:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:512/unit:8>>, latin1)),
  542:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:256/unit:8>>, utf8)),
  543:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:257/unit:8>>, utf8)),
  544:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:512/unit:8>>, utf8)),
  545:     ok.
  546: 
  547: test_binary_to_atom(Bin0, Encoding) ->
  548:     Res = binary_to_atom(Bin0, Encoding),
  549:     Res = binary_to_existing_atom(Bin0, Encoding),
  550:     if
  551:         Encoding =:= utf8;
  552:         Encoding =:= unicode ->
  553:             Res = binary_to_atom(Bin0),
  554:             Res = binary_to_existing_atom(Bin0);
  555:        true ->
  556:             ok
  557:     end,
  558:     Bin1 = id(<<7:3,Bin0/binary,32:5>>),
  559:     Sz = byte_size(Bin0),
  560:     <<_:3,UnalignedBin:Sz/binary,_:5>> = Bin1,
  561:     Res = binary_to_atom(UnalignedBin, Encoding).
  562: 
  563: fail_binary_to_atom(Bin) ->
  564:     try
  565:         binary_to_atom(Bin, latin1)
  566:     catch
  567:         error:badarg ->
  568:             ok
  569:     end,
  570:     try
  571:         binary_to_atom(Bin, utf8)
  572:     catch
  573:         error:badarg ->
  574:             ok
  575:     end,
  576:     try
  577:         binary_to_atom(Bin)
  578:     catch
  579:         error:badarg ->
  580:             ok
  581:     end,
  582:     try
  583:         binary_to_existing_atom(Bin, latin1)
  584:     catch
  585:         error:badarg ->
  586:             ok
  587:     end,
  588:     try
  589:         binary_to_existing_atom(Bin, utf8)
  590:     catch
  591:         error:badarg ->
  592:             ok
  593:     end,
  594:     try
  595:         binary_to_existing_atom(Bin)
  596:     catch
  597:         error:badarg ->
  598:             ok
  599:     end.
  600: 	
  601: 
  602: t_binary_to_existing_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  603:     UnlikelyBin = <<"ou0897979655678dsfj923874390867er869fds973qerueoru">>,
  604:     try
  605: 	binary_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyBin, latin1),
  606: 	ct:fail(atom_exists)
  607:     catch
  608: 	error:badarg -> ok
  609:     end,
  610: 
  611:     try
  612: 	binary_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyBin, utf8),
  613: 	ct:fail(atom_exists)
  614:     catch
  615: 	error:badarg -> ok
  616:     end,
  617:     try
  618: 	binary_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyBin),
  619: 	ct:fail(atom_exists)
  620:     catch
  621: 	error:badarg -> ok
  622:     end,
  623: 
  624:     UnlikelyAtom = binary_to_atom(id(UnlikelyBin), latin1),
  625:     UnlikelyAtom = binary_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyBin, latin1),
  626: 
  627:     %% ERL-944; a binary that was too large would overflow the latin1-to-utf8
  628:     %% conversion buffer.
  629:     OverflowAtom = <<0:511/unit:8,
  630:                      196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133,
  631:                      196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133,
  632:                      196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133,
  633:                      196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133>>,
  634:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch binary_to_existing_atom(OverflowAtom, latin1)),
  635: 
  636:     ok.
  637: 
  638: 
  639: t_atom_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  640:     HalfLong = lists:seq(0, 127),
  641:     HalfLongAtom = list_to_atom(HalfLong),
  642:     HalfLongBin = list_to_binary(HalfLong),
  643:     Long = lists:seq(0, 254),
  644:     LongAtom = list_to_atom(Long),
  645:     LongBin = list_to_binary(Long),
  646: 
  647:     %% latin1
  648:     <<>> = atom_to_binary('', latin1),
  649:     <<"abc">> = atom_to_binary(abc, latin1),
  650:     <<127>> = atom_to_binary('\177', latin1),
  651:     HalfLongBin = atom_to_binary(HalfLongAtom, latin1),
  652:     LongBin = atom_to_binary(LongAtom, latin1),
  653: 
  654:     %% utf8.
  655:     <<>> = atom_to_binary(''),
  656:     <<>> = atom_to_binary('', utf8),
  657:     <<>> = atom_to_binary('', unicode),
  658:     <<127>> = atom_to_binary('\177', utf8),
  659:     <<"abcdef">> = atom_to_binary(abcdef, utf8),
  660:     HalfLongBin = atom_to_binary(HalfLongAtom, utf8),
  661:     HalfLongBin = atom_to_binary(HalfLongAtom),
  662:     LongAtomBin = atom_to_binary(LongAtom, utf8),
  663:     LongAtomBin = atom_to_binary(LongAtom),
  664:     verify_long_atom_bin(LongAtomBin, 0),
  665: 
  666:     %% Failing cases.
  667:     fail_atom_to_binary(<<1>>),
  668:     fail_atom_to_binary(42),
  669:     fail_atom_to_binary({a,b,c}),
  670:     fail_atom_to_binary([1,2,3]),
  671:     fail_atom_to_binary([]),
  672:     fail_atom_to_binary(42.0),
  673:     fail_atom_to_binary(self()),
  674:     fail_atom_to_binary(make_ref()),
  675:     ?BADARG(atom_to_binary(id(a), blurf)),
  676:     ?BADARG(atom_to_binary(id(b), [])),
  677:     ok.
  678: 
  679: verify_long_atom_bin(<<I/utf8,T/binary>>, I) ->
  680:     verify_long_atom_bin(T, I+1);
  681: verify_long_atom_bin(<<>>, 255) -> ok.
  682: 
  683: fail_atom_to_binary(Term) ->
  684:     try
  685:         atom_to_binary(Term, latin1)
  686:     catch
  687:         error:badarg ->
  688:             ok
  689:     end,
  690:     try
  691:         atom_to_binary(Term, utf8)
  692:     catch
  693:         error:badarg ->
  694:             ok
  695:     end,
  696:     try
  697:         atom_to_binary(Term)
  698:     catch
  699:         error:badarg ->
  700:             ok
  701:     end.
  702: 
  703: 
  704: min_max(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  705:     Self = self(),
  706:     Port = hd(erlang:ports()),
  707:     Ref = make_ref(),
  708:     a = min(id(a), a),
  709:     a = min(id(a), b),
  710:     a = min(id(b), a),
  711:     b = min(id(b), b),
  712:     Ref = min(id(Self), id(Ref)),
  713: 
  714:     -3 = min(id(5), -3),
  715:     -3 = min(-3, id(5)),
  716:     -3 = min(0, id(-3)),
  717:     -3 = min(id(-3), 0),
  718:     0 = min(0, id(17)),
  719: 
  720:     a = max(id(a), a),
  721:     b = max(id(a), b),
  722:     b = max(id(b), a),
  723:     b = max(id(b), b),
  724:     Self = max(id(Self), id(Ref)),
  725: 
  726:     5 = max(id(5), -3),
  727:     5 = max(-3, id(5)),
  728:     0 = max(0, id(-3)),
  729:     0 = max(id(-3), 0),
  730:     17 = max(0, id(17)),
  731: 
  732:     %% Return the first argument when arguments are equal.
  733:     42.0 = min(id(42.0), 42),
  734:     42.0 = max(id(42.0), 42),
  735: 
  736:     Min = id(min),
  737:     Max = id(max),
  738: 
  739:     "abc" = erlang:Min("abc", "def"),
  740:     <<"def">> = erlang:Max(<<"abc">>, <<"def">>),
  741: 
  742:     %% Make sure that the JIT doesn't do any unsafe optimizations.
  743:     {0, 0} = min_max_zero(0),
  744:     {-7, 0} = min_max_zero(-7),
  745:     {0, 555} = min_max_zero(555),
  746:     {0, 1 bsl 64} = min_max_zero(1 bsl 64),
  747:     {-1 bsl 64, 0} = min_max_zero(-1 bsl 64),
  748: 
  749:     {-99, 23} = do_min_max(-99, 23),
  750:     {-10, 0} = do_min_max(0, -10),
  751:     {0, 77} = do_min_max(77, 0),
  752:     {1, 2} = do_min_max(1, 2),
  753:     {42, 99} = do_min_max(99, 42),
  754:     {100, 1 bsl 64} = do_min_max(100, 1 bsl 64),
  755:     {-1 bsl 64, 77} = do_min_max(77, -1 bsl 64),
  756:     {-1 bsl 64, 1 bsl 64} = do_min_max(1 bsl 64, -1 bsl 64),
  757:     {42.0, 43} = do_min_max(42.0, 43),
  758:     {42.0, 50.0} = do_min_max(42.0, 50.0),
  759:     {42.0, 42.0} = do_min_max(42.0, id(40.0 + 2.0)),
  760:     {{1,2}, {a,b}} = do_min_max({id(a), id(b)}, {id(1), id(2)}),
  761:     {{a,b}, [a,b]} = do_min_max({a,id(b)}, [a,id(b)]),
  762:     {{1.0,b}, {1.0,b}} = do_min_max({id(1.0), id(b)}, {id(1), id(b)}),
  763:     {{7,b}, {7,b}} = do_min_max({id(7), id(b)}, {id(7.0), id(b)}),
  764: 
  765:     {42,Self} = do_min_max(42, Self),
  766:     {42,Self} = do_min_max(Self, 42),
  767:     {42,Port} = do_min_max(42, Port),
  768:     {42,Port} = do_min_max(Port, 42),
  769: 
  770:     ok.
  771: 
  772: min_max_zero(A0) ->
  773:     Result = {min(A0, 0), max(A0, 0)},
  774:     Result = {min(0, A0), max(0, A0)},
  775:     A = id(A0),
  776:     Result = {min(A, 0), max(A, 0)},
  777:     Result = {min(0, A), max(0, A)}.
  778: 
  779: do_min_max(A0, B0) ->
  780:     Result = {min(A0, B0), max(A0, B0)},
  781: 
  782:     A0 = min(id(A0), A0),
  783:     A0 = max(id(A0), A0),
  784:     B0 = min(id(B0), B0),
  785:     B0 = max(id(B0), B0),
  786: 
  787:     A = id(A0),
  788:     B = id(B0),
  789:     Result = {min(A, B), max(A, B)},
  790: 
  791:     if
  792:         is_integer(A), is_atom(node(B)) orelse is_integer(B) ->
  793:             _ = id(0),
  794:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)};
  795:         is_atom(node(A)) orelse is_integer(A), is_integer(B) ->
  796:             _ = id(0),
  797:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)};
  798:         true ->
  799:             ok
  800:     end,
  801: 
  802:     if
  803:         is_integer(A), 0 =< A, A =< 1000, is_atom(node(B)) orelse is_integer(B) ->
  804:             _ = id(0),
  805:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)};
  806:         is_atom(node(A)) orelse is_integer(A), is_integer(B), 0 =< B, B =< 1000 ->
  807:             _ = id(0),
  808:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)};
  809:         true ->
  810:             ok
  811:     end,
  812: 
  813:     Result = do_min_max_1(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, A, B).
  814: 
  815: do_min_max_1(_, _, _, _, _, A, B) ->
  816:     if
  817:         is_integer(A), 0 =< A, A < 16#1_0000,
  818:         is_integer(B), 0 =< B, B < 16#1_0000 ->
  819:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  820:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)},
  821:             _ = id(0),
  822:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  823:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)};
  824:         is_integer(A), is_integer(B) ->
  825:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  826:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)},
  827:             _ = id(0),
  828:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  829:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)};
  830:         is_float(A), is_float(B) ->
  831:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  832:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)},
  833:             _ = id(0),
  834:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  835:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)};
  836:         is_number(A), is_number(B) ->
  837:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  838:             _ = id(0),
  839:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)};
  840:         true ->
  841:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  842:             _ = id(0),
  843:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)}
  844:     end.
  845: 
  846: erlang_halt(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  847:     try erlang:halt(undefined) of
  848: 	_-> ct:fail({erlang,halt,{undefined}})
  849:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  850:     try halt(undefined) of
  851: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{undefined}})
  852:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  853:     try erlang:halt(undefined, []) of
  854: 	_-> ct:fail({erlang,halt,{undefined,[]}})
  855:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  856:     try halt(undefined, []) of
  857: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{undefined,[]}})
  858:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  859:     try halt(0, undefined) of
  860: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,undefined}})
  861:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  862:     try halt(0, [undefined]) of
  863: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,[undefined]}})
  864:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  865:     try halt(0, [{undefined,true}]) of
  866: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,[{undefined,true}]}})
  867:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  868:     try halt(0, [{flush,undefined}]) of
  869: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,[{flush,undefined}]}})
  870:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  871:     try halt(0, [{flush,true,undefined}]) of
  872: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,[{flush,true,undefined}]}})
  873:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  874:     {ok, _, N1} = ?CT_PEER(),
  875:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N1, erlang, halt, []),
  876:     {ok, _, N2} = ?CT_PEER(),
  877:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N2, erlang, halt, [0]),
  878:     {ok, _, N3} = ?CT_PEER(),
  879:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N3, erlang, halt, [0,[]]),
  880:     {ok, _, N4} = ?CT_PEER(),
  881:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N4, erlang, halt, [lists:duplicate(300,$x)]),
  882:     %% Test unicode slogan
  883:     {ok, _, N5} = ?CT_PEER(),
  884:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N5, erlang, halt, [[339,338,254,230,198,295,167,223,32,12507,12531,12480]]),
  885: 
  886:     % This test triggers a segfault when dumping a crash dump
  887:     % to make sure that we can handle it properly.
  888: 
  889:     %% Prevent address sanitizer from catching SEGV in slave node
  890:     AsanOpts = add_asan_opt("handle_segv=0"),
  891:     {ok, _, N6} = ?CT_PEER(),
  892:     reset_asan_opts(AsanOpts),
  893: 
  894:     CrashDump = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  895:                               "segfault_erl_crash.dump"),
  896:     true = rpc:call(N6, os, putenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP",CrashDump]),
  897:     false = rpc:call(N6, erts_debug, set_internal_state,
  898:                      [available_internal_state, true]),
  899:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N6, erts_debug, set_internal_state,
  900:                                  [broken_halt, "Validate correct crash dump"]),
  901:     {ok,_} = wait_until_stable_size(CrashDump,-1),
  902:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(CrashDump),
  903:     case {string:find(Bin, <<"\n=end\n">>),
  904:           string:find(Bin, <<"\r\n=end\r\n">>)} of
  905:         {nomatch,nomatch} ->
  906:             ct:fail("Could not find end marker in crash dump");
  907:         {_,_} ->
  908:             ok
  909:     end.
  910: 
  911: 
  912: halt_flush_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  913:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 5}),
  914:     halt_flush_timeout_test(false, true),
  915:     halt_flush_timeout_test(true, true),
  916:     halt_flush_timeout_test(true, false).
  917: 
  918: halt_flush_timeout_test(HaltCmd, HaltOpt) ->
  919:     halt_flush_timeout_test_try(HaltCmd, HaltOpt, 1).
  920: 
  921: halt_flush_timeout_test_try(HaltCmd, HaltOpt, N) ->
  922:     case {HaltCmd, HaltOpt} of
  923:         {false, true} ->
  924:             ct:log("Test no ~p with flush_timeout option and "
  925:                    "default command line~n", [N]);
  926:         {true, true} ->
  927:             ct:log("Test no ~p with flush_timeout option and "
  928:                    "command line arg~n", [N]);
  929:         {true, false} ->
  930:             ct:log("Test no ~p with command line arg~n", [N])
  931:     end,
  932:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  933:     try
  934:         ok = halt_flush_timeout_test_run(Node, HaltCmd, HaltOpt),
  935:         peer:stop(Peer),
  936:         ok
  937:     catch
  938:         Class:Reason:Stack ->
  939:             ct:log("Failed with ~p reason: ~p~n"
  940:                    "at ~p~n", [Class, Reason, Stack]),
  941:             peer:stop(Peer),
  942:             if N == 5 ->
  943:                     erlang:raise(Class, Reason, Stack);
  944:                true ->
  945:                     halt_flush_timeout_test_try(HaltCmd, HaltOpt, N+1)
  946:             end
  947:     end.
  948: 
  949: halt_flush_timeout_test_run(BNode, HaltCmd, HaltOpt) ->
  950:     {ok, HNodePort, HNode} = start_halting_node(if HaltCmd == true -> "+zhft 1500";
  951:                                                    true -> ""
  952:                                                 end),
  953:     ok = erpc:call(BNode,
  954:                    fun () ->
  955:                            pong = net_adm:ping(HNode),
  956:                            erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  957:                            ok
  958:                    end),
  959:     erpc:cast(BNode,
  960:               fun () ->
  961:                       erts_debug:set_internal_state(block, 60*1000)
  962:               end),
  963:     wait_until(fun () ->
  964:                        try
  965:                            BNode = erpc:call(BNode, erlang, node, [], 1000),
  966:                            false
  967:                        catch
  968:                            error:{erpc,timeout} ->
  969:                                true
  970:                        end
  971:                end),
  972:     Data = lists:seq(1,1000),
  973:     SendData = fun SendData() ->
  974:                        {net_kernel, BNode} ! Data,
  975:                        SendData()
  976:                end,
  977:     Pid1 = spawn(HNode, SendData),
  978:     Pid2 = spawn(HNode, SendData),
  979:     IsBlocked = fun (Pid) ->
  980:                         fun () ->
  981:                                 case erpc:call(node(Pid), erlang, process_info, [Pid, status]) of
  982:                                     {status, suspended} -> true;
  983:                                     _Val -> false
  984:                                 end
  985:                         end
  986:                 end,
  987:     wait_until(IsBlocked(Pid1)),
  988:     wait_until(IsBlocked(Pid2)),
  989:     Start = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  990:     try
  991:         erpc:call(HNode,
  992:                   fun () ->
  993:                           if HaltOpt == true -> halt(0, [{flush, true},{flush_timeout, 1000}]);
  994:                              true -> halt()
  995:                           end
  996:                   end),
  997:         error(unexpected_return)
  998:     catch
  999:         error:{erpc,noconnection} ->
 1000:             ok
 1001:     end,
 1002:     ExitStatus = await_halting_node_exit(HNodePort),
 1003:     End = erlang:monotonic_time(),
 1004:     ct:log("ExitStatus=~p~n", [ExitStatus]),
 1005:     case erlang:convert_time_unit(End - Start, native, millisecond) of
 1006:         HaltTime when HaltOpt == true, 1000 =< HaltTime, HaltTime < 1500 ->
 1007:             ok;
 1008:         HaltTime when HaltOpt /= true, 1500 =< HaltTime, HaltTime < 2000 ->
 1009:             ok;
 1010:         HaltTime ->
 1011:             error({unexpected_halt_time, HaltTime})
 1012:     end,
 1013:     ExitStatus = 255, %% Exit status when timing out...
 1014:     ok.
 1015: 
 1016: start_halting_node(Args) ->
 1017:     Name = "halting_node-"
 1018:         ++ integer_to_list(erlang:system_time(second)) ++ "-"
 1019:         ++ integer_to_list(erlang:unique_integer([positive])),
 1020:     HostSuffix = lists:dropwhile(fun ($@) -> false; (_) -> true end,
 1021: 				 atom_to_list(node())),
 1022:     Node = list_to_atom(Name ++ HostSuffix),
 1023:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1024:     Prog = case catch init:get_argument(progname) of
 1025: 	       {ok,[[P]]} -> P;
 1026: 	       _ -> exit(no_progname_argument_found)
 1027: 	   end,
 1028:     NameSw = case net_kernel:longnames() of
 1029: 		 false -> "-sname ";
 1030: 		 true -> "-name ";
 1031: 		 _ -> exit(not_distributed_node)
 1032: 	     end,
 1033:     {ok, Pwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1034:     CmdLine =
 1035:         Prog ++ " -noinput -noshell " ++ Args
 1036: 	++ " " ++ NameSw ++ " " ++ Name ++ " "
 1037: 	++ "-pa " ++ Pa ++ " "
 1038: 	++ "-env ERL_CRASH_DUMP " ++ Pwd ++ "/erl_crash_dump." ++ Name ++ " "
 1039: 	++ "-setcookie " ++ atom_to_list(erlang:get_cookie()),
 1040:     ct:log("Starting node ~p: ~s~n", [Node, CmdLine]),
 1041:     case open_port({spawn, CmdLine}, [exit_status]) of
 1042: 	Port when is_port(Port) ->
 1043:             PingNode = fun PingNode(_PNode, 0) ->
 1044:                                pang;
 1045:                            PingNode(PNode, N) ->
 1046:                                case net_adm:ping(PNode) of
 1047:                                    pong ->
 1048:                                        pong;
 1049:                                    _ ->
 1050:                                        receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1051:                                        PingNode(PNode, N-1)
 1052:                                end
 1053:                        end,
 1054:             case PingNode(Node, 50) of
 1055: 		pong ->
 1056:                     {ok, Port, Node};
 1057: 		Other ->
 1058:                     error({failed_to_start_node, Node, Other})
 1059: 	    end;
 1060: 	Error ->
 1061:             error({failed_to_start_node, Node, Error})
 1062:     end.
 1063: 
 1064: await_halting_node_exit(Port) ->
 1065:     receive
 1066:         {Port, {data, _}} ->
 1067:             await_halting_node_exit(Port);
 1068:         {Port, {exit_status, ExitStatus}} ->
 1069:             ExitStatus
 1070:     end.
 1071: 
 1072: add_asan_opt(Opt) ->
 1073:     case test_server:is_asan() of
 1074: 	true ->
 1075: 	    case os:getenv("ASAN_OPTIONS") of
 1076: 		false ->
 1077: 		    os:putenv("ASAN_OPTIONS", Opt),
 1078: 		    undefined;
 1079: 		AO ->
 1080: 		    os:putenv("ASAN_OPTIONS", AO ++ [$: | Opt]),
 1081: 		    AO
 1082: 	    end;
 1083: 	_ ->
 1084: 	    false
 1085:     end.
 1086: 
 1087: reset_asan_opts(false) -> ok;
 1088: reset_asan_opts(undefined) -> os:unsetenv("ASAN_OPTIONS");
 1089: reset_asan_opts(AO) -> os:putenv("ASAN_OPTIONS", AO).
 1090: 
 1091: wait_until_stable_size(_File,-10) ->
 1092:     {error,enoent};
 1093: wait_until_stable_size(File,PrevSz) ->
 1094:     timer:sleep(250),
 1095:     case file:read_file_info(File) of
 1096:         {error,enoent} ->
 1097:             wait_until_stable_size(File,PrevSz-1);
 1098:         {ok,#file_info{size = PrevSz }} when PrevSz /= -1 ->
 1099:             io:format("Crashdump file size was: ~p (~s)~n",[PrevSz,File]),
 1100:             {ok,PrevSz};
 1101:         {ok,#file_info{size = NewSz }} ->
 1102:             wait_until_stable_size(File,NewSz)
 1103:     end.
 1104: 
 1105: % Test erlang:halt with ERL_CRASH_DUMP_BYTES
 1106: erl_crash_dump_bytes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1107:     Bytes = 1000,
 1108:     CrashDump = do_limited_crash_dump(Config, Bytes),
 1109:     {ok,ActualBytes} = wait_until_stable_size(CrashDump,-1),
 1110:     true = ActualBytes < (Bytes + 100),
 1111: 
 1112:     NoDump = do_limited_crash_dump(Config,0),
 1113:     {error,enoent} = wait_until_stable_size(NoDump,-8),
 1114:     ok.
 1115: 
 1116: do_limited_crash_dump(Config, Bytes) ->
 1117:     {ok, _, N} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1118:     BytesStr = integer_to_list(Bytes),
 1119:     CrashDump = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1120:                               "erl_crash." ++ BytesStr ++ ".dump"),
 1121:     true = rpc:call(N, os, putenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP",CrashDump]),
 1122:     true = rpc:call(N, os, putenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP_BYTES",BytesStr]),
 1123:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N, erlang, halt, ["Testing ERL_CRASH_DUMP_BYTES"]),
 1124:     CrashDump.
 1125: 
 1126: 
 1127: is_builtin(_Config) ->
 1128:     Exp0 = [{M,F,A} || {M,_} <- code:all_loaded(),
 1129: 		       {F,A} <- M:module_info(exports)],
 1130:     Exp = ordsets:from_list(Exp0),
 1131: 
 1132:     %% Built-ins implemented as special instructions.
 1133:     Instructions = [{erlang,apply,2},{erlang,apply,3},{erlang,yield,0}],
 1134: 
 1135:     Builtins0 = Instructions ++ erlang:system_info(snifs),
 1136:     Builtins = ordsets:from_list(Builtins0),
 1137: 
 1138:     Fakes = [{M,F,42} || {M,F,_} <- Instructions],
 1139:     All = ordsets:from_list(Fakes ++ Exp),
 1140:     NotBuiltin = ordsets:subtract(All, Builtins),
 1141: 
 1142:     _ = [{true,_} = {erlang:is_builtin(M, F, A),MFA} ||
 1143:             {M,F,A}=MFA <- Builtins],
 1144:     _ = [{false,_} = {erlang:is_builtin(M, F, A),MFA} ||
 1145:             {M,F,A}=MFA <- NotBuiltin],
 1146: 
 1147:     ok.
 1148: 
 1149: error_stacktrace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1150:     error_stacktrace_test().
 1151: 
 1152: error_stacktrace_during_call_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1153:     Tracer = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1154: 				receive after infinity -> ok end
 1155: 			end),
 1156:     Mprog = [{'_',[],[{exception_trace}]}],
 1157:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE,'_','_'}, Mprog, [local]),
 1158:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern({erlang,error,2}, Mprog, [local]),
 1159:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern({erlang,error,1}, Mprog, [local]),
 1160:     erlang:trace(all, true, [call,return_to,timestamp,{tracer, Tracer}]),
 1161:     try
 1162: 	error_stacktrace_test()
 1163:     after
 1164: 	erlang:trace(all, false, [call,return_to,timestamp,{tracer, Tracer}]),
 1165: 	erlang:trace_pattern({erlang,error,2}, false, [local]),
 1166: 	erlang:trace_pattern({erlang,error,1}, false, [local]),
 1167: 	erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE,'_','_'}, false, [local]),
 1168: 	unlink(Tracer),
 1169: 	exit(Tracer, kill),
 1170: 	Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Tracer),
 1171: 	receive
 1172: 	    {'DOWN', Mon, process, Tracer, _} -> ok
 1173: 	end
 1174:     end,
 1175:     ok.
 1176: 
 1177: error_stacktrace_test() ->
 1178:     Types = [apply_const_last, apply_const, apply_last,
 1179: 	     apply, double_apply_const_last, double_apply_const,
 1180: 	     double_apply_last, double_apply, multi_apply_const_last,
 1181:              apply_const_only, apply_only,
 1182: 	     multi_apply_const, multi_apply_last, multi_apply,
 1183: 	     call_const_last, call_last, call_const, call],
 1184:     lists:foreach(fun (Type) ->
 1185: 			  {Pid, Mon} = spawn_monitor(
 1186: 					 fun () ->
 1187: 						 stk([a,b,c,d], Type, error_2)
 1188: 					 end),
 1189: 			  receive
 1190: 			      {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, Reason} ->
 1191: 				  {oops, Stack} = Reason,
 1192: %%				  io:format("Type: ~p Stack: ~p~n",
 1193: %%					    [Type, Stack]),
 1194: 				  [{?MODULE, do_error_2, [Type], _},
 1195: 				   {?MODULE, stk, 3, _},
 1196: 				   {?MODULE, stk, 3, _}] = Stack
 1197: 			  end
 1198: 		  end,
 1199: 		  Types),
 1200:     lists:foreach(fun (Type) ->
 1201: 			  {Pid, Mon} = spawn_monitor(
 1202: 					 fun () ->
 1203: 						 stk([a,b,c,d], Type, error_1)
 1204: 					 end),
 1205: 			  receive
 1206: 			      {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, Reason} ->
 1207: 				  {oops, Stack} = Reason,
 1208: %%				  io:format("Type: ~p Stack: ~p~n",
 1209: %%					    [Type, Stack]),
 1210: 				  [{?MODULE, do_error_1, 1, _},
 1211: 				   {?MODULE, stk, 3, _},
 1212: 				   {?MODULE, stk, 3, _}] = Stack
 1213: 			  end
 1214: 		  end,
 1215: 		  Types),
 1216:     ok.
 1217: 
 1218: stk([_|L], Type, Func) ->
 1219:     stk(L, Type, Func),
 1220:     %% Force the compiler to keep this body-recursive. We want the stack trace
 1221:     %% to have one entry here and another in the base case to test that
 1222:     %% multiple frames in the same function aren't removed unless they're
 1223:     %% identical.
 1224:     id(ok);
 1225: stk([], Type, Func) ->
 1226:     put(erlang, erlang),
 1227:     put(tail, []),
 1228:     tail(Type, Func, jump),
 1229:     id(ok).
 1230: 
 1231: tail(Type, Func, jump) ->
 1232:     tail(Type, Func, do);
 1233: tail(Type, error_1, do) ->
 1234:     do_error_1(Type);
 1235: tail(Type, error_2, do) ->
 1236:     do_error_2(Type).
 1237: 
 1238: do_error_2(apply_const_only) ->
 1239:     apply(erlang, error, [oops, [apply_const_only]]);
 1240: do_error_2(apply_only) ->
 1241:     Erlang = get(erlang),
 1242:     Tail = get(tail),
 1243:     apply(Erlang, error, [oops, [apply_only|Tail]]);
 1244: do_error_2(apply_const_last) ->
 1245:     erlang:apply(erlang, error, [oops, [apply_const_last]]);
 1246: do_error_2(apply_const) ->
 1247:     erlang:apply(erlang, error, [oops, [apply_const]]),
 1248:     ok;
 1249: do_error_2(apply_last) ->
 1250:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [apply_last]]));
 1251: do_error_2(apply) ->
 1252:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [apply]])),
 1253:     ok;
 1254: do_error_2(double_apply_const_last) ->
 1255:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops, [double_apply_const_last]]]);
 1256: do_error_2(double_apply_const) ->
 1257:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops, [double_apply_const]]]),
 1258:     ok;
 1259: do_error_2(double_apply_last) ->
 1260:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [double_apply_last]])]);
 1261: do_error_2(double_apply) ->
 1262:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [double_apply]])]),
 1263:     ok;
 1264: do_error_2(multi_apply_const_last) ->
 1265:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops, [multi_apply_const_last]]]]]);
 1266: do_error_2(multi_apply_const) ->
 1267:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops, [multi_apply_const]]]]]),
 1268:     ok;
 1269: do_error_2(multi_apply_last) ->
 1270:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [multi_apply_last]])]]]);
 1271: do_error_2(multi_apply) ->
 1272:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [multi_apply]])]]]),
 1273:     ok;
 1274: do_error_2(call_const_last) ->
 1275:     erlang:error(oops, [call_const_last]);
 1276: do_error_2(call_last) ->
 1277:     erlang:error(id(oops), id([call_last]));
 1278: do_error_2(call_const) ->
 1279:     erlang:error(oops, [call_const]),
 1280:     ok;
 1281: do_error_2(call) ->
 1282:     erlang:error(id(oops), id([call])).
 1283: 
 1284: 
 1285: do_error_1(apply_const_only) ->
 1286:     apply(erlang, error, [oops]);
 1287: do_error_1(apply_only) ->
 1288:     Erlang = get(erlang),
 1289:     Tail = get(tail),
 1290:     apply(Erlang, error, [oops|Tail]);
 1291: do_error_1(apply_const_last) ->
 1292:     erlang:apply(erlang, error, [oops]);
 1293: do_error_1(apply_const) ->
 1294:     erlang:apply(erlang, error, [oops]),
 1295:     ok;
 1296: do_error_1(apply_last) ->
 1297:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(error), id([oops]));
 1298: do_error_1(apply) ->
 1299:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])),
 1300:     ok;
 1301: do_error_1(double_apply_const_last) ->
 1302:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops]]);
 1303: do_error_1(double_apply_const) ->
 1304:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops]]),
 1305:     ok;
 1306: do_error_1(double_apply_last) ->
 1307:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])]);
 1308: do_error_1(double_apply) ->
 1309:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])]),
 1310:     ok;
 1311: do_error_1(multi_apply_const_last) ->
 1312:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops]]]]);
 1313: do_error_1(multi_apply_const) ->
 1314:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops]]]]),
 1315:     ok;
 1316: do_error_1(multi_apply_last) ->
 1317:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])]]]);
 1318: do_error_1(multi_apply) ->
 1319:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])]]]),
 1320:     ok;
 1321: do_error_1(call_const_last) ->
 1322:     erlang:error(oops);
 1323: do_error_1(call_last) ->
 1324:     erlang:error(id(oops));
 1325: do_error_1(call_const) ->
 1326:     erlang:error(oops),
 1327:     ok;
 1328: do_error_1(call) ->
 1329:     erlang:error(id(oops)).
 1330: 
 1331: 
 1332: group_leader_prio(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1333:     group_leader_prio_test(false).
 1334: 
 1335: group_leader_prio_dirty(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1336:     group_leader_prio_test(true).
 1337: 
 1338: group_leader_prio_test(Dirty) ->
 1339:     %%
 1340:     %% Unfortunately back in the days node local group_leader/2 was not
 1341:     %% implemented as sending an asynchronous signal to the process to change
 1342:     %% group leader for. Instead it has always been synchronously changed, and
 1343:     %% nothing in the documentation have hinted otherwise... Therefore I do not
 1344:     %% dare the change this.
 1345:     %%
 1346:     %% In order to prevent priority inversion, the priority of the receiver of
 1347:     %% the group leader signal is elevated while handling incoming signals if
 1348:     %% the sender has a higher priority than the receiver. This test tests that
 1349:     %% the priority elevation actually works...
 1350:     %%
 1351:     Tester = self(),
 1352:     Init = erlang:whereis(init),
 1353:     GL = erlang:group_leader(),
 1354:     process_flag(priority, max),
 1355:     {TestProcFun, NTestProcs}
 1356:         = case Dirty of
 1357:               false ->
 1358:                   %% These processes will handle all incoming signals
 1359:                   %% by them selves...
 1360:                   {fun () ->
 1361:                            Tester ! {alive, self()},
 1362:                            receive after infinity -> ok end
 1363:                    end,
 1364:                    100};
 1365:               true ->
 1366:                   %% These processes won't handle incoming signals by
 1367:                   %% them selves since they are stuck on dirty schedulers
 1368:                   %% when we try to change group leader. A dirty process
 1369:                   %% signal handler process (system process) will be notified
 1370:                   %% of the need to handle incoming signals for these processes,
 1371:                   %% and will instead handle the signal for these processes...
 1372:                   {fun () ->
 1373:                            %% The following sends the message '{alive, self()}'
 1374:                            %% to Tester once on a dirty io scheduler, then wait
 1375:                            %% there until the process terminates...
 1376:                            erts_debug:dirty_io(alive_waitexiting, Tester)
 1377:                    end,
 1378:                    erlang:system_info(dirty_io_schedulers)}
 1379:           end,
 1380:     TPs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1381:                             spawn_opt(TestProcFun,
 1382:                                       [link, {priority, normal}])
 1383:                     end, lists:seq(1, NTestProcs)),
 1384:     lists:foreach(fun (TP) -> receive {alive, TP} -> ok end end, TPs),
 1385:     TLs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1386:                             spawn_opt(fun () -> tok_loop() end,
 1387:                                       [link, {priority, high}])
 1388:                     end,
 1389:                     lists:seq(1, 2*erlang:system_info(schedulers))),
 1390:     %% Wait to ensure distribution of high prio processes over schedulers...
 1391:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1392:     %%
 1393:     %% Test that we can get group-leader signals through to normal prio
 1394:     %% processes from a max prio process even though all schedulers are filled
 1395:     %% with executing high prio processes.
 1396:     %%
 1397:     lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 1398:                           lists:foreach(fun (TP) ->
 1399:                                                 erlang:yield(),
 1400:                                                 %% whitebox -- Enqueue some signals on it
 1401:                                                 %% preventing us from hogging its main lock
 1402:                                                 %% and set group-leader directly....
 1403:                                                 erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, TP)),
 1404:                                                 true = erlang:group_leader(Init, TP),
 1405:                                                 {group_leader, Init} = process_info(TP, group_leader),
 1406:                                                 erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, TP)),
 1407:                                                 true = erlang:group_leader(GL, TP),
 1408:                                                 {group_leader, GL} = process_info(TP, group_leader)
 1409:                                         end,
 1410:                                         TPs)
 1411:                   end,
 1412:                   lists:seq(1,100)),
 1413:     %%
 1414:     %% Also test when it is exiting...
 1415:     %%
 1416:     lists:foreach(fun (TP) ->
 1417:                           erlang:yield(),
 1418:                           M = erlang:monitor(process, TP),
 1419:                           unlink(TP),
 1420:                           exit(TP, bang),
 1421:                           badarg = try
 1422:                                        true = erlang:group_leader(Init, TP)
 1423:                                    catch
 1424:                                        error : What -> What
 1425:                                    end,
 1426:                           receive
 1427:                               {'DOWN', M, process, TP, Reason} ->
 1428:                                   bang = Reason
 1429:                           end
 1430:                   end,
 1431:                   TPs),
 1432:     lists:foreach(fun (TL) ->
 1433:                           M = erlang:monitor(process, TL),
 1434:                           unlink(TL),
 1435:                           exit(TL, bang),
 1436:                           receive
 1437:                               {'DOWN', M, process, TL, Reason} ->
 1438:                                   bang = Reason
 1439:                           end
 1440:                   end,
 1441:                   TLs),
 1442:     ok.
 1443: 
 1444: is_process_alive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1445:     process_flag(priority, max),
 1446:     Ps = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1447:                            spawn_opt(fun () -> tok_loop() end,
 1448:                                      [{priority, high}, link])
 1449:                    end,
 1450:                    lists:seq(1, 2*erlang:system_info(schedulers))),
 1451:     receive after 1000 -> ok end, %% Wait for load to spread
 1452:     lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 1453:                           %% Ensure that signal order is preserved
 1454:                           %% and that we are not starved due to
 1455:                           %% priority inversion
 1456:                           true = erlang:is_process_alive(P),
 1457:                           unlink(P),
 1458:                           true = erlang:is_process_alive(P),
 1459:                           exit(P, kill),
 1460:                           false = erlang:is_process_alive(P)
 1461:                   end,
 1462:                   Ps),
 1463:     ok.
 1464: 
 1465: is_process_alive_signal_from(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1466:     process_flag(priority, high),
 1467:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 1468:     Schdlr = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
 1469:                  1 -> 1;
 1470:                  _ -> 2
 1471:              end,
 1472:     X = is_process_alive_signal_from_test(100000, 0, Schdlr),
 1473:     erlang:display({exits_detected, X}),
 1474:     {comment, integer_to_list(X) ++ " exited processes detected"}.
 1475: 
 1476: is_process_alive_signal_from_test(0, X, _Schdlr) ->
 1477:     X;
 1478: is_process_alive_signal_from_test(N, X, Schdlr) ->
 1479:     Tester = self(),
 1480:     {Testee, TMon} = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1481:                                        Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1482:                                        Tester ! {self(), ready},
 1483:                                        busy_wait_go(),
 1484:                                        _ = erlang:demonitor(Mon),
 1485:                                        exit(normal)
 1486:                                end,
 1487:                                [link,
 1488:                                 monitor,
 1489:                                 {priority, high},
 1490:                                 {scheduler, Schdlr}]),
 1491:     receive {Testee, ready} -> ok end,
 1492:     {monitored_by, MBList1} = process_info(self(), monitored_by),
 1493:     true = lists:member(Testee, MBList1),
 1494:     erlang:yield(),
 1495:     Testee ! {go, ok},
 1496:     erlang:yield(),
 1497:     NewX = case erlang:is_process_alive(Testee) of
 1498:                true ->
 1499:                    X;
 1500:                false ->
 1501:                    %% Demonitor signal should have reached us before the
 1502:                    %% is-process-alive reply...
 1503:                    {monitored_by, MBList2} = process_info(self(), monitored_by),
 1504:                    false = lists:member(Testee, MBList2),
 1505:                    X+1
 1506:            end,
 1507:     receive {'DOWN', TMon, process, Testee, normal} -> ok end,
 1508:     is_process_alive_signal_from_test(N-1, NewX, Schdlr).
 1509: 
 1510: process_info_blast(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1511:     Tester = self(),
 1512:     NoAttackers = 1000,
 1513:     NoAL = lists:seq(1, NoAttackers),
 1514:     Consume = make_ref(),
 1515:     Victim = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1516:                                 receive
 1517:                                     Consume ->
 1518:                                         ok
 1519:                                 end,
 1520:                                 consume_msgs()
 1521:                         end),
 1522:     AFun = fun () ->
 1523:                    Victim ! hej,
 1524:                    Res = process_info(Victim, message_queue_len),
 1525:                    Tester ! {self(), Res}
 1526:            end,
 1527:     Attackers0 = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1528:                                    spawn_link(AFun)
 1529:                            end,
 1530:                            NoAL),
 1531:     lists:foreach(fun (A) ->
 1532:                           receive
 1533:                               {A, Res} ->
 1534:                                   case Res of
 1535:                                       {message_queue_len, Len} when Len > 0, Len =< NoAttackers ->
 1536:                                           Len;
 1537:                                       Error ->
 1538:                                           exit({unexpected, Error})
 1539:                                   end
 1540:                           end
 1541:                   end,
 1542:                   Attackers0),
 1543:     Attackers1 = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1544:                                    spawn_link(AFun)
 1545:                            end,
 1546:                            NoAL),
 1547:     Victim ! Consume,
 1548:     lists:foreach(fun (A) ->
 1549:                           receive
 1550:                               {A, Res} ->
 1551:                                   case Res of
 1552:                                       {message_queue_len, Len} when Len >= 0, Len =< 2*NoAttackers+1 ->
 1553:                                           ok;
 1554:                                       undefined ->
 1555:                                           ok;
 1556:                                       Error ->
 1557:                                           exit({unexpected, Error})
 1558:                                   end
 1559:                           end
 1560:                   end,
 1561:                   Attackers1),
 1562:     KillFun = fun (P) ->
 1563:                       unlink(P),
 1564:                       exit(P, kill),
 1565:                       false = erlang:is_process_alive(P)
 1566:               end,
 1567:     lists:foreach(fun (A) -> KillFun(A) end, Attackers0),
 1568:     lists:foreach(fun (A) -> KillFun(A) end, Attackers1),
 1569:     KillFun(Victim),
 1570:     ok.
 1571: 
 1572: consume_msgs() ->
 1573:     receive
 1574:         _ ->
 1575:             consume_msgs()
 1576:     after 0 ->
 1577:               ok
 1578:     end.
 1579: 
 1580: 
 1581: %% Test that process_info(Pid, [message_queue_len]) works correctly when
 1582: %%  fetching part of the middle signal queue into inner queue.
 1583: verify_middle_queue_save(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1584:     Control = self(),
 1585:     ProcessToHang = spawn_link(
 1586:         fun () ->
 1587:             Single = self(),
 1588:             put(count, 0),
 1589:             Doubles = [spawn_link(fun () -> message_queue_len_retrievers(Single, 0) end) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 2)],
 1590:             Control ! {doubles, Doubles},
 1591:             process_that_hangs(Control, 0, Doubles)
 1592:         end),
 1593:     ensure_not_hanging(ProcessToHang, [], 50000).
 1594: 
 1595: process_that_hangs(Control, Total, Doubles) ->
 1596:     put(count, Total),
 1597:     %% fetch something innocent, like 'priority' of the process
 1598:     [process_info(Pid, [priority]) || Pid <- Doubles],
 1599:     Control ! alive,
 1600:     process_that_hangs(Control, Total + 1, Doubles).
 1601: 
 1602: message_queue_len_retrievers(Control, PrevCount) ->
 1603:     %% need to fetch dictionary for test reasons, but actual trigger is 'message_queue_len',
 1604:     %%  or 'memory', or 'total_heap_size' - anything that needs to fetch external message queue
 1605:     %%  via ERTS_PI_FLAG_NEED_MSGQ_LEN internal flag to process_info
 1606:     [_, {dictionary, [{count, Count}]}] = erlang:process_info(Control, [message_queue_len, dictionary]),
 1607:     Count > PrevCount andalso begin Control ! count end,
 1608:     message_queue_len_retrievers(Control, Count).
 1609: 
 1610: ensure_not_hanging(Proc, _Doubles, 0) ->
 1611:     unlink(Proc),
 1612:     exit(Proc, kill);
 1613: ensure_not_hanging(Proc, Doubles, Remaining) ->
 1614:     receive
 1615:         alive ->
 1616:             ensure_not_hanging(Proc, Doubles, Remaining - 1);
 1617:         {doubles, NewDoubles} ->
 1618:             ensure_not_hanging(Proc, NewDoubles, Remaining)
 1619:     after 1000 ->
 1620:         Reason = {Proc, "hung", erlang:process_info(Proc, backtrace)},
 1621:         unlink(Proc),
 1622:         exit(Proc, kill),
 1623:         ct:fail(Reason)
 1624:     end.
 1625: 
 1626: %% Test that length/1 returns the correct result after trapping, and
 1627: %% also that the argument is correct in the stacktrace for a badarg
 1628: %% exception.
 1629: 
 1630: test_length(_Config) ->
 1631:     {Start,Inc} = case test_server:timetrap_scale_factor() of
 1632:                       1 -> {16*4000,3977};
 1633:                       _ -> {100,1}
 1634:             end,
 1635:     Good = lists:reverse(lists:seq(1, Start)),
 1636:     Bad = Good ++ [bad|cons],
 1637:     test_length(Start, 10*Start, Inc, Good, Bad),
 1638: 
 1639:     %% Test that calling length/1 from a match spec works.
 1640:     MsList = lists:seq(1, 2*Start),
 1641:     MsInput = [{tag,Good},{tag,MsList}],
 1642:     Ms0 = [{{tag,'$1'},[{'>',{length,'$1'},Start}],['$1']}],
 1643:     Ms = ets:match_spec_compile(Ms0),
 1644:     [MsList] = ets:match_spec_run(MsInput, Ms),
 1645:     ok.
 1646: 
 1647: test_length(I, N, Inc, Good, Bad) when I < N ->
 1648:     Length = id(length),
 1649:     I = length(Good),
 1650:     I = erlang:Length(Good),
 1651: 
 1652:     %% Test length/1 in guards.
 1653:     if
 1654:         length(Good) =:= I ->
 1655:             ok
 1656:     end,
 1657:     if
 1658:         length(Bad) =:= I ->
 1659:             error(should_fail);
 1660:         true ->
 1661:             ok
 1662:     end,
 1663: 
 1664:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[{erlang,length,[[I|_]],_}|_]}} = (catch length(Bad)),
 1665:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[{erlang,length,[[I|_]],_}|_]}} = (catch erlang:Length(Bad)),
 1666:     IncSeq = lists:seq(I + 1, I + Inc),
 1667:     test_length(I+Inc, N, Inc,
 1668:                 lists:reverse(IncSeq, Good),
 1669:                 lists:reverse(IncSeq, Bad));
 1670: test_length(_, _, _, _, _) -> ok.
 1671: 
 1672: %% apply/3 with a fixed number of arguments didn't include all arguments on
 1673: %% badarg exceptions.
 1674: fixed_apply_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1675:     Bad = id({}),
 1676: 
 1677:     {'EXIT',{badarg, [{erlang,apply,[{},baz,[a,b]],[{error_info,_}]} | _]}} =
 1678:         (catch Bad:baz(a,b)),
 1679:     {'EXIT',{badarg, [{erlang,apply,[baz,{},[c,d]],[{error_info,_}]} | _]}} =
 1680:         (catch baz:Bad(c,d)),
 1681: 
 1682:     {'EXIT',{badarg, [{erlang,apply,[{},baz,[e,f]],[{error_info,_}]} | _]}} =
 1683:         (catch apply(Bad,baz,[e,f])),
 1684:     {'EXIT',{badarg, [{erlang,apply,[baz,{},[g,h]],[{error_info,_}]} | _]}} =
 1685:         (catch apply(baz,Bad,[g,h])),
 1686: 
 1687:     ok.
 1688: 
 1689: external_fun_apply3(_Config) ->
 1690:     %% erlang:apply/3 would always badarg when called through an external fun.
 1691: 
 1692:     Apply = id(fun erlang:apply/3),
 1693:     Self = Apply(erlang, self, []),
 1694:     true = is_pid(Self),
 1695: 
 1696:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Apply(does, 'not', [exist])),
 1697: 
 1698:     ok.
 1699: 
 1700: node_1(_Config) ->
 1701:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1702: 
 1703:     local_node(self()),
 1704:     LocalPort = lists:last(erlang:ports()),
 1705:     local_node(LocalPort),
 1706:     local_node(make_ref()),
 1707: 
 1708:     external_node(erpc:call(Node, erlang, self, []), Node),
 1709:     ExtPort = hd(erpc:call(Node, erlang, ports, [])),
 1710:     external_node(ExtPort, Node),
 1711:     external_node(erpc:call(Node, erlang, make_ref, []), Node),
 1712: 
 1713:     node_error(a),
 1714:     node_error(42),
 1715:     node_error({a,b,c}),
 1716:     node_error({tag,self()}),
 1717:     node_error([self()]),
 1718:     node_error(1 bsl 133),
 1719:     node_error(#{}),
 1720:     node_error(#{id(a) => b}),
 1721:     node_error(<<"binary">>),
 1722: 
 1723:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1724:     ok.
 1725: 
 1726: local_node(E) ->
 1727:     test_node(E, node()).
 1728: 
 1729: external_node(E, Node) ->
 1730:     test_node(E, Node).
 1731: 
 1732: test_node(E0, Node) ->
 1733:     true = node(id(E0)) =:= Node,
 1734:     E = id(E0),
 1735:     if
 1736:         node(E) =:= Node ->
 1737:             ok
 1738:     end,
 1739:     test_node_2(id(E), Node).
 1740: 
 1741: test_node_2(E, Node) when is_pid(E); is_port(E); is_reference(E) ->
 1742:     true = node(E) =:= Node,
 1743:     if
 1744:         node(E) =:= Node ->
 1745:             ok
 1746:     end,
 1747:     test_node_3(id(E), Node),
 1748:     ok.
 1749: 
 1750: test_node_3(E, Node) when is_pid(E) ->
 1751:     true = node(E) =:= Node;
 1752: test_node_3(E, Node) when is_port(E) ->
 1753:     true = node(E) =:= Node;
 1754: test_node_3(E, Node) when is_reference(E) ->
 1755:     true = node(E) =:= Node.
 1756: 
 1757: node_error(E0) ->
 1758:     E = id(E0),
 1759:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[{erlang,node,[E],_}|_]}} = catch node(E),
 1760:     if
 1761:         node(E) ->
 1762:             ct:fail(should_fail);
 1763:         true ->
 1764:             ok
 1765:     end.
 1766: 
 1767: %% helpers
 1768: 
 1769: wait_until(Fun) ->
 1770:     case Fun() of
 1771:         true ->
 1772:             ok;
 1773:         _ ->
 1774:             receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1775:             wait_until(Fun)
 1776:     end.
 1777: 
 1778: busy_wait_go() ->
 1779:     receive
 1780:         {go, Info} ->
 1781:             Info
 1782:     after
 1783:         0 ->
 1784:             busy_wait_go()
 1785:     end.
 1786: 
 1787: id(I) -> I.
 1788: 
 1789: %% Get code path, including the path for the erts application.
 1790: get_code_path() ->
 1791:     Erts = filename:join([code:root_dir(),"erts","preloaded","ebin"]),
 1792:     case filelib:is_dir(Erts) of
 1793: 	true->
 1794: 	    [Erts|code:get_path()];
 1795: 	_ ->
 1796: 	    code:get_path()
 1797:     end.
 1798: 
 1799: which(Mod, Path) ->
 1800:     which_1(atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".beam", Path).
 1801: 
 1802: which_1(Base, [D|Ds]) ->
 1803:     Path = filename:join(D, Base),
 1804:     case filelib:is_regular(Path) of
 1805: 	true -> Path;
 1806: 	false -> which_1(Base, Ds)
 1807:     end.
 1808: print_mfa({M,F,A}) ->
 1809:     io:format("~p:~p/~p", [M,F,A]).
 1810: 
 1811: extract_abstract(Mod, Path) ->
 1812:     Beam = which(Mod, Path),
 1813:     {ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} =
 1814: 	beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1815:     {Mod,Abstr}.
 1816: 
 1817: 
 1818: tok_loop() ->
 1819:     tok_loop(hej).
 1820: 
 1821: tok_loop(hej) ->
 1822:     tok_loop(hopp);
 1823: tok_loop(hopp) ->
 1824:     tok_loop(hej).
